joxy.utils

Class Output

  • java.lang.Object
    • joxy.utils.Output

  • public class Output
extends Object
    This class provides methods to output messages to the "outside world". All output from the Joxy LookAndFeel should come via this class, where can be decided if it should be print or not. That is, debug messages will only be print if in debug mode. Also, it is possible to suppress all output via this class.
    All messages will be output with a flag:
    • [D] - Debug message;
    • [I] - Regular message;
    • [W] - Warning message;
    • [E] - Error message.
    Author:
    Thom Castermans, Willem Sonke

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int OUTPUT_MODE_DEBUG
      Debug mode: all messages, including debug, are print.
      static int OUTPUT_MODE_ERROR
      Error mode: only error messages are print.
      static int OUTPUT_MODE_QUIET
      Quiet mode: all messages are suppressed.
      static int OUTPUT_MODE_VERBOSE
      Verbose mode: all messages, except for debug, are print.
      static int OUTPUT_MODE_WARNING
      Warning mode: only warning and error messages are print.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static void debug()
      Print the caller class and caller method.
      static void debug(Object message)
      Print the given message in the form "[D] callerClass.callerMethod(): message", for example "[D] joxy.utils.Utils.method(): this is a debugmessage".
      static void debugComponent(Component component, String indent)
      Prints debug information about a component, and does the same for its children.
      static void error(Object message)
      Print the given message in the form "[E] callerClass.callerMethod(): message", for example "[E] joxy.utils.Utils.method(): this is an error".
      static void print(Object message)
      Print the given message in the form "[I] callerClass.callerMethod(): message", for example "[I] joxy.utils.Utils.method(): this is a message".
      static void setMode(int outputMode)
      Change the output mode.
      static void warning(Object message)
      Print the given message in the form "[W] callerClass.callerMethod(): message", for example "[W] joxy.utils.Utils.method(): this is a warning".

    • Method Detail

      • debug

        public static void debug(Object message)
        Print the given message in the form "[D] callerClass.callerMethod(): message", for example "[D] joxy.utils.Utils.method(): this is a debugmessage". Message is print only in debug mode.
        Parameters:
        message - The message to be output.

      • debug

        public static void debug()
        Print the caller class and caller method.

      • print

        public static void print(Object message)
        Print the given message in the form "[I] callerClass.callerMethod(): message", for example "[I] joxy.utils.Utils.method(): this is a message". Message is print only in verbose and debug mode.
        Parameters:
        message - The message to be output.

      • warning

        public static void warning(Object message)
        Print the given message in the form "[W] callerClass.callerMethod(): message", for example "[W] joxy.utils.Utils.method(): this is a warning". Message is print only when not in quiet or error mode.
        Parameters:
        message - The message to be output.

      • error

        public static void error(Object message)
        Print the given message in the form "[E] callerClass.callerMethod(): message", for example "[E] joxy.utils.Utils.method(): this is an error". Message is print only when not in quiet mode.
        Parameters:
        message - The message to be output.

      • setMode

        public static void setMode(int outputMode)
        Change the output mode.
        Parameters:
        outputMode - The new output mode.

      • debugComponent

        public static void debugComponent(Component component,
                  String indent)
        Prints debug information about a component, and does the same for its children.
        Parameters:
        component - The component to display information about.
        indent - The indentation. This should be "" on the first call.
